In short, keeping track of where you have already evaluated in the 
design =
space, such that a subsequent evaluation request for the same 
point in the=
 design space results in either: a) the original 
evaluation results are pa=
ssed back as the results for the current 
request without additional evalua=
tion, or b) the requestor is told to 
try again with a different request, d=
epending on the context.

In the context of NEAT, it is effectively a "gate=
-keeper" standing 
between "data_evaluate" and the call to the fitness eval=
uator. 
Regardless of the topology of the current organism, if the same set=
 
of input parameters to the fitness evaluator are presented for 
evaluatio=
n, the original evaluation results are returned. In a more 
advanced implem=
entation, a surrogate model maybe used, depending upon 
the degree of prior=
 evaluations in the region of the evaluation 
request, the local slope of t=
he hyperspace, and the level-of-accuracy 
currently in effect.

but

importance of maintaining history (see pages 9, 20, 39, 40 and

 Their conclusion was that the implementation of a history block

consistent

world

raries applicable to
